claim: Recombinant technology leads to a broader immune response that may provide cross-protection, even in a mismatch season.
explanation: A table showing adjusted vaccine effectiveness (VE) of recombinant quadrivalent influenza vaccine (RIV4) versus no vaccination, and of standard-dose inactivated quadrivalent influenza vaccine (SD-IIV4) versus no vaccination, as well as relative VE of RIV4 compared to SD-IIV4 across subgroups (overall, by sex, age, risk condition) and by season (2018–2019, 2019–2020). The table presents vaccine effectiveness estimates but does not address breadth of immune response, cross-protection, or mismatch seasons. It contains no data on recombinant technology–induced broader immunity or cross-protection, so it does not support the claim.
